text: Epihippus is an extinct genus of the modern horse family Equidae that lived in the Eocene, from 46 to 38 million years ago. Epihippus is believed to have evolved from Orohippus, which continued the evolutionary trend of increasingly efficient grinding teeth. Epihippus had five grinding, low-crowned cheek teeth with well-formed crests. A late species of Epihippus, sometimes referred to as Duchesnehippus intermedius, had teeth similar to Oligocene equids, although slightly less developed. Whether Duchesnehippus was a subgenus of Epihippus or a distinct genus is disputed. This is an early species of a horse. There are three species: * Epihippus gracilis * Epihippus intermedius * Epihippus uintensis ==References== Category:Eocene horses Category:Eocene odd-toed ungulates Category:Eocene mammals of North America Category:Paleogene United States Category:Prehistoric mammal genera Category:Extinct mammals of North America Category:Eocene genus extinctions Category:Eocene extinctions Category:Fossil taxa described in 1877
title: Epihippus
